item.title: Doom add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Doom add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I would believe only in a God that knows how to dance." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Doom add a quote by William Shakespeare
Doom add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I have no idea what's awaiting me, or what will happen when this all ends. For the moment I know this: there are sick people and they need curing." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Doom add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Who lives longer? The man who takes heroin for two years and dies, or a man who lives on roast beef, water and potatoes 'till 95? One passes his 24 months in eternity. All the years of the beefeater are lived only in time." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Doom add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Doom add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Doom add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Doom add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Doom add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "And wherever men are fighting against barbarism, tyranny, and massacre, for freedom, law, and honour, let them remember that the fame of their deeds, even though they themselves be exterminated, may perhaps be celebrated as long as the world rolls round." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Doom add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell
